cards.name: Rewind
cards.text: Counter target spell. Untap up to four lands.
cards.flavor:
"Time flows like a river. In Tolaria we practice the art of building dams."
—Barrin, master wizard

rulings.text: Rewind targets only a spell. It doesn't target any lands. The lands are chosen as Rewind resolves.
You can choose up to four lands, no matter who controls any of them. Those lands untap once. You can't choose one land and have it untap four times, for example.

If the spell is an illegal target when Rewind tries to resolve, perhaps because it was countered by another spell or ability, Rewind will be countered and none of its effects will happen. You won't untap any lands.
If Rewind resolves but the target spell can't be countered, you'll still untap lands.

cards.source: English Urza's Destiny boosters in place of uncommon cards

cards.name: Karn, Silver Golem
cards.text:
Whenever Karn, Silver Golem blocks or becomes blocked, it gets -4/+4 until end of turn.
{1}: Target noncreature artifact becomes an artifact creature with power and toughness each equal to its converted mana cost until end of turn.

rulings.text: The blocking ability triggers only once no matter how many blockers are declared.

A noncreature permanent that turns into a creature can attack, and its {T} abilities can be activated, only if its controller has continuously controlled that permanent since the beginning of his or her most recent turn. It doesn't matter how long the permanent has been a creature.

cards.source: English Urza's Destiny boosters in place of uncommon cards

cards.name: Duress
cards.text: Target opponent reveals his or her hand. You choose a noncreature, nonland card from it. That player discards that card.
cards.flavor:
"We decide who is worthy of our works."
—Gix, Yawgmoth praetor
cards.source: English Urza's Destiny boosters in place of uncommon cards

cards.name: Uktabi Orangutan
cards.text: When Uktabi Orangutan enters the battlefield, destroy target artifact.
cards.flavor:
"Is it true that the apes wear furs of gold when they marry?"
—Rana, Suq'Ata market fool

cards.name: Chill
cards.text: Red spells cost {2} more to cast.
cards.flavor:
"Temper, temper."
—Ertai, wizard adept

cards.name: Pillage
cards.text: Destroy target artifact or land. It can't be regenerated.

cards.name: Enlightened Tutor
cards.text: Search your library for an artifact or enchantment card and reveal that card. Shuffle your library, then put the card on top of it.
cards.flavor:
"I do not teach. I simply reveal."
—Daudi, Femeref tutor

rulings.text: The "shuffle and put the card on top" is a single action. If an effect causes the top card of the library to be face up, the second card down is not revealed.

cards.name: Stupor
cards.text: Target opponent discards a card at random, then discards a card.
cards.flavor: There are medicines for all afflictions but idleness. —Suq'Ata saying

cards.name: Creeping Mold
cards.text: Destroy target artifact, enchantment, or land.
cards.flavor:
"Mold could catch you."
—Suq'Ata insult

cards.name: Dismiss
cards.text:
Counter target spell.
Draw a card.
cards.flavor:
"There is nothing you can do that I cannot simply deny."
—Ertai, wizard adept

cards.name: Fling
cards.text:
As an additional cost to cast Fling, sacrifice a creature.
Fling deals damage equal to the sacrificed creature's power to target creature or player.
cards.flavor: It's raining rats and moggs.

rulings.text: The sacrificed creature's last known existence on the battlefield is checked to determine its power.

If you sacrifice an attacking or blocking creature during the declare blockers step, it won't deal combat damage. If you wait until the combat damage step, but that creature is dealt lethal damage, it'll be destroyed before you get a chance to sacrifice it.
You must sacrifice exactly one creature to cast this spell; you cannot cast it without sacrificing a creature, and you cannot sacrifice additional creatures.
Players can only respond once this spell has been cast and all its costs have been paid. No one can try to destroy the creature you sacrificed to prevent you from casting this spell.

cards.name: Empyrial Armor
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +1/+1 for each card in your hand.
cards.flavor: "An angel appeared in the smoldering skies above the fray, her clothes as flames, her armor as fire." -"Hymn of Angelfire"

rulings.text: The value of X is recalculated constantly, so this card's bonus varies as the number of cards in your hand varies.

cards.name: Diabolic Edict
cards.text: Target player sacrifices a creature.
cards.flavor: Greven il-Vec lifted Vhati off his feet. "The fall will give you time to think on your failure."

cards.name: Gaea's Blessing
cards.text:
Target player shuffles up to three target cards from his or her graveyard into his or her library.
Draw a card.
When Gaea's Blessing is put into your graveyard from your library, shuffle your graveyard into your library.

rulings.text: When you cast Gaea's Blessing, you can't choose it as one of its own targets. This is because you choose the targets when casting this spell, and spells are not put into your graveyard until after they resolve.
You must target a player as you cast Gaea's Blessing. You may target zero, one, two, or three cards in that player's graveyard.

cards.name: Man-o'-War
cards.text: When Man-o'-War enters the battlefield, return target creature to its owner's hand.
cards.flavor:
"Beauty to the eye does not always translate to the touch."
—Naimah, Femeref philospher

rulings.text: If there are no other creatures on the battlefield when Man-o'-War enters the battlefield, its ability must target itself.

cards.name: Arc Lightning
cards.text: Arc Lightning deals 3 damage divided as you choose among one, two, or three target creatures and/or players.
cards.flavor:
"It is vain to look for a defense against lightning."
—Publius Syrus, Maxim 835, trans. Lyman

rulings.text: You choose how many targets Arc Lightning has and how the damage is divided as you cast the spell. Each target must receive at least 1 damage.

If some of the creatures are illegal targets as Arc Lightning tries to resolve, the original division of damage still applies but no damage is dealt to the illegal targets. If all targets are illegal, Arc Lightning is countered.

cards.name: Dauthi Slayer
cards.text:
Shadow (This creature can block or be blocked by only creatures with shadow.)
Dauthi Slayer attacks each combat if able.
cards.flavor:
"A wisp of life remains in the undergloom of Death; a visible form, though no heart beats within it."
—Homer, The Iliad, trans. Fitzgerald

cards.name: Mana Leak
cards.text: Counter target spell unless its controller pays {3}.
cards.flavor:
"If a man will begin with certainties, he shall end in doubts."
—Sir Francis Bacon, The Advancement of Learning

cards.name: Skirk Marauder
cards.text:
Morph {2}{R} (You may cast this card face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its morph cost.)
When Skirk Marauder is turned face up, it deals 2 damage to target creature or player.

rulings.text: The trigger occurs when you use the Morph ability to turn the card face up, or when an effect turns it face up. It will not trigger on being revealed or on leaving the battlefield.

cards.name: Elvish Aberration
cards.text:
{T}: Add {G}{G}{G} to your mana pool.
Forestcycling {2} ({2}, Discard this card: Search your library for a Forest card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then shuffle your library.)

rulings.text: Unlike the normal cycling ability, Forestcycling doesn't allow you to draw a card. Instead, it lets you search your library for a Forest card. After you find a Forest card in your library, you reveal it, put it into your hand, then shuffle your library.

Forestcycling is a form of cycling. Any ability that triggers on a card being cycled also triggers on Forestcycling this card. Any ability that stops a cycling ability from being activated also stops Forestcycling from being activated.

Forestcycling is an activated ability. Effects that interact with activated abilities (such as Stifle or Rings of Brighthearth) will interact with Forestcycling. Effects that interact with spells (such as Remove Soul or Faerie Tauntings) will not.
You can choose to find any card with the Forest land type, including nonbasic lands. You can also choose not to find a card, even if there is a Forest card in your library.

cards.name: Bonesplitter
cards.text:
Equipped creature gets +2/+0.
Equip {1}

cards.name: Darksteel Ingot
cards.text:
Indestructible
{T}: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool.

foreignNames.name: ダークスティールの鋳塊

cards.name: Serum Visions
cards.text: Draw a card. Scry 2.
cards.source: Arena League Fifth Dawn season prize

cards.name: Glacial Ray
cards.text:
Glacial Ray deals 2 damage to target creature or player.
Splice onto Arcane {1}{R} (As you cast an Arcane spell, you may reveal this card from your hand and pay its splice cost. If you do, add this card's effects to that spell.)

rulings.text: You reveal all cards you intend to splice at the same time. Each individual card can be spliced only once onto any one spell.
A card with a splice ability can't be spliced onto itself because the spell is on the stack (and not in your hand) when you reveal the cards you want to splice onto it.

You choose all targets for the spell after revealing cards you want to splice, including any targets required by the text of any of those cards. You may choose a different target for each instance of the word "target" on the resulting spell.
If all of the spell's targets are illegal when the spell tries to resolve, it will be countered and none of its effects will happen.

cards.source: Arena League Champions of Kamigawa season prize

cards.name: Circle of Protection: Art
cards.text:
As Circle of Protection: Art comes into play, choose an artist.
{1}{W}: The next time a source of your choice by the chosen artist would deal damage to you this turn, prevent that damage.
{1}{W}: Return Circle of Protection: Art to its owner's hand.

cards.name: Mise
cards.text: Name a nonland card, then reveal the top card of your library. If that card is the named card, draw three cards.
cards.flavor: Statistically mind-staggering as it might seem, the term "mise" was in fact coined simultaneously by over one thousand Magic players.

cards.name: Booster Tutor
cards.text: Open a sealed Magic booster pack, reveal the cards, and put one of those cards into your hand. (Remove that card from your deck before beginning a new game.)
cards.flavor: Make your judgment wisely: The right pack will let you defeat your nemesis, but a poor choice can only end in torment. And Homelands.

cards.name: Goblin Mime
cards.text: When you speak, sacrifice Goblin Mime.
cards.flavor: Mung noticed a few clouds gathering in the sky. Perhaps today he could perform his "walking against the wind" routine.

cards.name: Granny's Payback
cards.text: You gain life equal to your age.
cards.flavor: Few remember the exploits of Dakkon's grandmother, Eunice Blackblade.

cards.name: Ashnod's Coupon
cards.text:
{T}, Sacrifice Ashnod's Coupon: Target player gets you target drink.
Errata: You pay any costs for the drink.
cards.flavor: Limited time offer. Void where prohibited. Limit one per purchase. Valid only in participating duels. This coupon is nontransferable and invalid if shattered, crumbled, detonated, pillaged, or otherwise disenchanted. Cash value less than 1/20 of a cent. Offer not valid in Quebec, Rhode Island, or where prohibited by law or the DCI.

cards.name: Genju of the Spires
cards.text:
Enchant Mountain
{2}: Enchanted Mountain becomes a 6/1 red Spirit creature until end of turn. It's still a land.
When enchanted Mountain is put into a graveyard, you may return Genju of the Spires from your graveyard to your hand.

rulings.text: A noncreature permanent that turns into a creature can attack, and its {T} abilities can be activated, only if its controller has continuously controlled that permanent since the beginning of his or her most recent turn. It doesn't matter how long the permanent has been a creature.

cards.source: Arena League Betrayers of Kamigawa season prize

cards.name: Okina Nightwatch
cards.text: As long as you have more cards in hand than each opponent, Okina Nightwatch gets +3/+3.
cards.flavor: Only the most skilled budoka could protect the Okina Shrine. Only the best of these protectors took the night watch.
cards.source: Arena League Saviors of Kamigawa season prize

cards.name: Skyknight Legionnaire
cards.text: Flying, haste
cards.flavor:
I do not know which gives me more pride: the legions of soldiers marching in thunderous lockstep, or the cry of the skyknights riding their rocs like jagged lightning overhead.
—Razia
cards.source: Arena League Ravnica: City of Guilds season prize

cards.name: Castigate
cards.text: Target opponent reveals his or her hand. You choose a nonland card from it and exile that card.
cards.flavor:
"We have no need for military might. We wield two of the sharpest swords ever forged: Faith in our left hand, Wealth in our right."
—Vuliev of the Ghost Council

cards.name: Wee Dragonauts
cards.text:
Flying
Whenever you cast an instant or sorcery spell, Wee Dragonauts gets +2/+0 until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
The blazekite is a simple concept, really - just a vehicular application of dragscoop ionics and electropropulsion magnetronics.
—Juzba, Izzet tinker

rulings.text: Wee Dragonauts's triggered ability will resolve before the spell that caused it to trigger.

cards.name: Coiling Oracle
cards.text: When Coiling Oracle enters the battlefield, reveal the top card of your library. If it's a land card, put it onto the battlefield. Otherwise, put that card into your hand.
cards.flavor: Snaking remnants of nature directed by a body of thought and progress, the oracles embody all that is Simic.

cards.name: Surging Flame
cards.text:
Ripple 4 (When you cast this spell, you may reveal the top four cards of your library. You may cast any revealed cards with the same name as this spell without paying their mana costs. Put the rest on the bottom of your library.)
Surging Flame deals 2 damage to target creature or player.

cards.name: Underworld Dreams
cards.text: Whenever an opponent draws a card, Underworld Dreams deals 1 damage to him or her.
cards.flavor:
"In the drowsy dark cave of the mind, dreams build their nest with fragments dropped from day's caravan."
—Rabindranath Tagore

rulings.text: If multiple cards are drawn at once, this card triggers once for each card drawn.
In a multi-player game, it affects all opponents.

cards.name: Char
cards.text: Char deals 4 damage to target creature or player and 2 damage to you.
cards.flavor: If you've never choked on the embers of your own spell, you aren't casting it hard enough.
cards.source: Comic Con Magic Fifteenth Anniversary Tournament

cards.name: Kamahl, Pit Fighter
cards.text:
Haste (This creature can attack and {T} as soon as it comes under your control.)
{T}: Kamahl, Pit Fighter deals 3 damage to target creature or player.
cards.flavor: In times when freedom seems lost, great souls arise to reclaim it.

rulings.text: The Legend rule only applies to two legendary permanents with identical names. If the names are different, even if they depict the same character, the rule does not apply.

foreignNames.name: ピット・ファイター、カマール

cards.name: Putrid Imp
cards.text:
Discard a card: Putrid Imp gains flying until end of turn.
Threshold — As long as seven or more cards are in your graveyard, Putrid Imp gets +1/+1 and can't block.
cards.originalText:
Discard a card: Putrid Imp gains flying until end of turn.
Threshold — As long as seven or more cards are in your graveyard, Putrid Imp gets +1/+1 and can't block.

cards.name: Hidden Horror
cards.text: When Hidden Horror enters the battlefield, sacrifice it unless you discard a creature card.
cards.flavor: If the presence of evil were obvious, it wouldn't be nearly as dangerous.

rulings.text: When the ability resolves, you choose whether to sacrifice the creature or perform the other action. If you can't perform the other action, then you must sacrifice the creature.
If the creature is no longer on the battlefield when the ability resolves, you may still perform the action if you want.

cards.originalText: When Hidden Horror enters the battlefield, sacrifice it unless you discard a creature card.

cards.name: Faceless Butcher
cards.text:
When Faceless Butcher enters the battlefield, exile target creature other than Faceless Butcher.
When Faceless Butcher leaves the battlefield, return the exiled card to the battlefield under its owner's control.

rulings.text: Three Faceless Butchers cast in succession with no other creatures on the battlefield will result in an infinite loop and the game will be a draw, unless a player somehow interrupts the loop.

cards.originalText:
When Faceless Butcher enters the battlefield, exile target creature other than Faceless Butcher.
When Faceless Butcher leaves the battlefield, return the exiled card to the battlefield under its owner's control.

cards.name: Twisted Abomination
cards.text:
{B}: Regenerate Twisted Abomination.
Swampcycling {2} ({2}, Discard this card: Search your library for a Swamp card, reveal it, put it into your hand, then shuffle your library.)

rulings.text: Unlike the normal cycling ability, Swampcycling doesn't allow you to draw a card. Instead, it lets you search your library for a Swamp card. After you find a Swamp card in your library, you reveal it, put it into your hand, then shuffle your library.

Swampcycling is a form of cycling. Any ability that triggers on a card being cycled also triggers on Swampcycling this card. Any ability that stops a cycling ability from being activated also stops Swampcycling from being activated.

Swampcycling is an activated ability. Effects that interact with activated abilities (such as Stifle or Rings of Brighthearth) will interact with Swampcycling. Effects that interact with spells (such as Remove Soul or Faerie Tauntings) will not.
You can choose to find any card with the Swamp land type, including nonbasic lands. You can also choose not to find a card, even if there is a Swamp card in your library.

cards.originalText:
{B}: Regenerate Twisted Abomination.
Swampcycling {2} ({2}, Discard this card: Search your library for a Swamp card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then shuffle your library.)

cards.name: Crosis, the Purger
cards.text:
Flying
Whenever Crosis, the Purger deals combat damage to a player, you may pay {2}{B}. If you do, choose a color, then that player reveals their hand and discards all cards of that color.

rulings.text: You choose the color during resolution. This means your opponent does not get to react after knowing the color you chose.

cards.originalText:
Flying
Whenever Crosis, the Purger deals combat damage to a player, you may pay {2}{B}. If you do, choose a color, then that player reveals his or her hand and discards all cards of that color.

cards.name: Avatar of Woe
cards.text:
If there are ten or more creature cards total in all graveyards, this spell costs {6} less to cast.
Fear (This creature can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or black creatures.)
{T}: Destroy target creature. It can't be regenerated.

rulings.text: The converted mana cost of this card is still 8, even if you only pay {B}{B} to cast it.

cards.originalText:
If there are ten or more creature cards total in all graveyards, Avatar of Woe costs {6} less to cast.
Fear (This creature can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or black creatures.)
{T}: Destroy target creature. It can't be regenerated.

cards.name: Terastodon
cards.text: When Terastodon enters the battlefield, you may destroy up to three target noncreature permanents. For each permanent put into a graveyard this way, its controller creates a 3/3 green Elephant creature token.

rulings.text: The targeted permanents may be controlled by different players.

If a targeted permanent has indestructible or regenerates, its controller won't get an Elephant token for it. Similarly, if the targeted permanent is destroyed but a replacement effect moves it to a different zone instead of its owner's graveyard, its controller won't get an Elephant token for it.

cards.originalText: When Terastodon enters the battlefield, you may destroy up to three target noncreature permanents. For each permanent put into a graveyard this way, its controller puts a 3/3 green Elephant creature token onto the battlefield.

cards.name: Verdant Force
cards.text: At the beginning of each upkeep, create a 1/1 green Saproling creature token.
cards.flavor: Left to itself, nature overflows any container, overthrows any restriction, and overreaches any boundary.

rulings.text: In Two-Headed Giant, triggers only once per upkeep, not once for each player.
Verdant Force's ability triggers at the beginning of each upkeep, not just each of your upkeeps.

cards.originalText: At the beginning of each upkeep, put a 1/1 green Saproling creature token onto the battlefield.

cards.name: Sphinx of the Steel Wind
cards.text: Flying, first strike, vigilance, lifelink, protection from red and from green
cards.flavor: No one has properly answered her favorite riddle: "Why should I spare your life?"
cards.originalText: Flying, first strike, vigilance, lifelink, protection from red and from green

cards.name: Inkwell Leviathan
cards.text:
Trample
Islandwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls an Island.)
Shroud (This creature can't be the target of spells or abilities.)
cards.flavor:
"Into its maw went the seventh sea, never to be seen again while the world remains."
—Esper fable

cards.name: Blazing Archon
cards.text:
Flying
Creatures can't attack you.
cards.flavor:
"Through the haze of battle I saw the glint of sun on golden mane, the sheen of glory clad in mail, and I dropped my sword and wept at the idiocy of war."
—Dravin, Gruul deserter

rulings.text: Unless some effect explicitly says otherwise, a creature that can't attack you can still attack a planeswalker you control.

cards.name: Cabal Therapy
cards.text:
Choose a nonland card name. Target player reveals their hand and discards all cards with that name.
Flashback—Sacrifice a creature. (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)

rulings.text: You name the card as Cabal Therapy resolves, not as you cast it. Then the targeted player reveals their hand and discards if appropriate. No player may choose to take actions between you naming the card and the targeted player revealing and discarding.

cards.originalText:
Name a nonland card. Target player reveals his or her hand and discards all cards with that name.
Flashback—Sacrifice a creature. (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)

cards.name: Duress
cards.text: Target opponent reveals their hand. You choose a noncreature, nonland card from it. That player discards that card.
cards.flavor:
"Don't worry. I'm not going to deprive you of all your secrets. Just your most precious one."
—Liliana Vess
cards.originalText: Target opponent reveals his or her hand. You choose a noncreature, nonland card from it. That player discards that card.
